description: From Old French dignifier, from Late Latin dignificare, from dignus (“worthy”) + ficare (in comp.), facere (“to make”). See deign and fact.

verbs.description: dignify (third-person singular simple present dignifies, present participle dignifying, simple past and past participle dignified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To invest with dignity or honour.
(transitive, chiefly in the negative) To treat as worthy or acceptable; to indulge or condone by acknowledging.
examples: I will not dignify that comment with a response.
